asteroids.model

Class Ship

  • java.lang.Object
    • asteroids.model.Ship

  • public class Ship
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing spaceships. - Spaceships are represented as circles with radius r [km]. - They have a position [km] and velocity [km/s] expressed in a Cartesian coordinate system with x- and y-coordinates. - They also have an orientation angle, expressed in radians.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    De Heel Benson, De Jaegere Xander

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ship()
      Initialize this new spaceship with its default values, the default for the speed limit being the speed of light.
      Ship(double positionX, double positionY, double velocityX, double velocityY, double radius, double angle)
      initialize this Ship with the given parameters and the speed limit on its maximum value
      Ship(double positionX, double positionY, double velocityX, double velocityY, double radius, double angle, double speedLimit)
      Initialize this new spaceship with the given parameters.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ship

        public Ship(double positionX,
            double positionY,
            double velocityX,
            double velocityY,
            double radius,
            double angle,
            double speedLimit)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Initialize this new spaceship with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        positionX - The x-component of the position of the spaceship.
        positionY - The y-component of the position of the spaceship.
        velocityX - The x-component of the velocity of the spaceship.
        velocityY - The y-component of the velocity of the spaceship.
        radius - The radius of the spaceship.
        angle - The orientation angle of the spaceship.
        speedLimit - The maximum velocity of the spaceship.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentEception - the given position is infinite or has Double.Nan as a value | isInfinite(positionX) || isNaN(positionX) | isInfinite(positionY) || isNan(positionY)
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given radius is infinite or smaller than the minimal radius of this spaceship. | radius == INFINITE OR radius < minimalRadius

public double[] getPosition()
        Return the position of the spaceship.
        Returns:
        The position of the spaceship represented by an array as [xPosition, yPosition].

        y - The y-component of the position of this spaceship.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given parameter x or y is infinite or equal to NaN | x == INFINITE OR y == INFINITE OR x == NaN OR y == NaN

        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • getTotalVelocity

        public double getTotalVelocity()
        Return the length of the velocity vector of this spaceship.
        Returns:
        The total velocity of this spaceship which is the length of its velocity vector. | sqrt(getVelocityX()^2+getVelocityY()^2)

      • isValidVelocity

        public boolean isValidVelocity(double velocityX,
                               double velocityY)
        Checks whether the total velocity is smaller than or equal to the speed limit of this spaceship.
        Parameters:
        velocityX - The x-component of the velocity vector.
        velocityY - The y-component of the velocity vector.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the velocity is smaller than or equal to the speed limit of this ship. | result == sqrt(velocityY^2 + velocityX^2) <= speedLimit

      • isValidSpeedLimit

        public boolean isValidSpeedLimit(double speedLimit)
        Checks whether the given speedLimit is a valid speed.
        Parameters:
        speedLimit - The speed limit that needs to be verified.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given speedLimit is positive and smaller than or equal to the speed of light. | (0 <= speedLimit <= c)

      • killVelocity

        public void killVelocity()
        Cancels the ship's velocity setting it to 0

      • thrust

        public void thrust(double amount)
        Change the ship's velocity based on the current velocity, orientation and given amount.
        Parameters:
        amount - The length of the vector which will be incremented to the ship's velocity vector. This vector will be parallel to the ship's velocity vector.

        Parameters:

      • isValidAngle

        public boolean isValidAngle(double angle)
        Checks whether the given angle is a valid angle.
        Parameters:
        currentAngle - The current angle of the spaceship.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given angle is between 0 and 2*PI | result == (0 <= angle) AND (angle <= 2*PI)

      • turn

        public void turn(double angle)
        Turn the spaceship with the given angle.
        Parameters:
        angle - The size of change of rotation the angle. A negative angle will result in an anti-clockwise rotation. A positive angle will result in a clockwise rotation.

      • getDistanceBetween

        public double getDistanceBetween(Ship otherShip)
                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Calculate the distance in between this ship and a given other ship.
        Parameters:
        otherShip - The other ship involved in the calculation of the distance in between both ships.
        Returns:
        The distance between this ship and otherShip. The distance may be negative if both ships overlap. if the this == otherShip the distance will be zero | if(this== otherShip) | then this.getDistanceBetween(otherShip) == 0 | if(this.overlap(otherShip)) | then this.getDistanceBetween(otherShip) < 0 | else | this.getDistanceBetween(otherShip) > 0
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - The given otherShip is null. | otherShip == null

      • overlap

        public boolean overlap(Ship otherShip)
                throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Checks whether two ships overlap.
        Parameters:
        otherShip - The other ship involved in the calculations.
        Returns:
        True if and only if this ship and otherShip overlap. | this.getDistanceBetween(otherShip) <= 0
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException

      • getTimeToCollision

        public double getTimeToCollision(Ship otherShip)
                          throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        otherShip - The other ship that collides with this ship.
        Returns:
        The resulting double will be the time in seconds that it takes for the two ships to collide. | let | new = this.move(result) | newOtherShip = otherShip.move(result)µ | in | new.getDistanceBetween(newOtherShip) == 0
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getCollisionPosition

        public double[] getCollisionPosition(Ship otherShip)
                              throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return the position of this ship when this ship and the given other ship collide. This method returns null if this ship and the given other ship never collide.
        Parameters:
        otherShip - The other ship that collides with this ship.
        Returns:
        An array with the x- and y-components of the position where this ship and the given otherShip collide.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - The given otherShip is null | otherShip == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - the ship overlaps with the other ship | this.overlap(otherShip)
